instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00239: What is 820-00239? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A flashing folder with question mark
threads.message:
The laptop came very slow to task, I decided to restore it, it got stocked on 1 minute remaining finalizing the restore, I waited for almost 5hrs, still remaining……. So I decided to swap the board in to another macbook for restore, it started flashing folder with question mark

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5_SSD</SIGNAL> -0.7v
<SIGNAL>PP1V2_SSD_HOT</SIGNAL>-0v
<SIGNAL>PP1V2_SSD_COLD</SIGNAL>-0v
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_SSD_COLD</SIGNAL>-0v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_2V7_NAND_VCC</SIGNAL>-0v
No short
Pls help

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A flashing folder with question mark
threads.message: Did you fix J9600 in place?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A flashing folder with question mark
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A flashing folder with question mark
threads.message: Just checked it’s not in place.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A flashing folder with question mark
threads.message: The metal place of Lifeboat connector MUST be in placa; if not, SSD is not available.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A flashing folder with question mark
threads.message:
Thanks ssd is back. 
The response was very slow when the system came. I have put the board into another macbook body. Still very slow, then I decided to restore. Now is stucked on less than one minute remaining. And the fan is spinning very high. it wount pass that stage. 
thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A flashing folder with question mark
threads.message:
Did PRAM reset?
Fans spin fast from start, or after 20-30s?
Battery is recognized and charging?
Any error pops up starting in diagnostic mode?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A flashing folder with question mark
threads.message:
yes I did a pram reset
The fan start Speeding from recovery mode to the point of  less than a minute remaining…..
Battery has a charging sign and it’s charged to 100%
The fan sped all through the restore
still stocked at leas than a minute remaining.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A flashing folder with question mark
threads.message:
Check if you can boot into Windows/Linux Live.
You may try known good BIOS, clean ME.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A flashing folder with question mark
threads.message: Sorry I don’t understand the “clean ME”

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A flashing folder with question mark
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A flashing folder with question mark
threads.message: I have install another bios <CHIP>U6100</CHIP>. Still very laggy, dragging, slow, after klicks it wount respond immediately.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A flashing folder with question mark
threads.message:
Changed the BIOS chip, or reflashed it with clean ME BIOS?

Try to respond to all recommended tests.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A flashing folder with question mark
threads.message: Sorry I don’t know how to go about the clean me bios. I just replaced the bios with a known good one. Am installing Big Sur via the flash drive. Stucked at that “ less than a minute remaining and it l8ter progress a little bit after 12hrs. The progress bar was stocked at 90% progress bar. And I later discovered that the system was actually freezing, noting is responding except the fan spin, the apple logo with 90% progress bar.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A flashing folder with question mark
threads.message:
You need to clean ME region!
Use this file for test:
[URL unfurl="true"]https://drive.google.com/file/d/1IBKRLzpoxzsyI8hJ8xOG9gjn7BH1VCJp/view?usp=sharing[/URL]
